p: Mice were immunized intramuscularly in both shaved hind legs (musculus gastrocnemius) under anaesthesia (100 mg/kg ketamine and 15 mg/kg xylazine). The indicated amounts of DNA plasmids were injected in a volume of 30 μl PBS per leg followed by local electroporation about one second later [ 54]. Electroporation was performed with a 4-electrode array that applied electric signals of 63 V amplitude and 40 ms total duration (Ichor Medical Inc.). Blood samples were collected from the retro-orbital sinus under anaesthesia with inhaled isoflurane.
